name: chatgpt_prod_rooftop_gdb_fz_condensation
description: [GPT Prod] Rooftop outdoor + GDB FZ â†’ condensation risk, suggest GDMI-ZM
query: We need GDB 600x600 in Galvanized (FZ) for rooftop exhaust installation. Airflow is 3,400 mÂ³/h. The housing will be exposed to outdoor weather conditions year-round. Please confirm suitability.

turns.content: We need GDB 600x600 in Galvanized (FZ) for rooftop exhaust installation. Airflow is 3,400 mÂ³/h. The housing will be exposed to outdoor weather conditions year-round. Please confirm suitability.

For the rooftop exhaust application, the GDB filter housing with galvanized steel (FZ) is not suitable for outdoor installation. The GDB housing uses bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for outdoor environments. Outdoor installation also exposes the system to Outdoor Condensation and High Humidity. Outdoor Condensation on the C2-rated housing can cause condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces, while High Humidity reduces the carbon adsorption efficiency and accelerates zinc corrosion.I cannot recommend the GDB family for this application. Instead, I can offer the GDMI FLEX series, which is better suited for outdoor conditions. To finalize the configuration:To finalize the configuration:

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identifies a critical misapplication (installing an uninsulated, indoor-rated GDB housing on a rooftop) and blocks it, citing valid corrosion and condensation risks. It suggests the appropriate catalog alternative (GDMI FLEX) which offers insulation and higher corrosion resistance (C4). There is a minor hallucination regarding 'carbon adsorption' for a particle filter housing, and a text generation glitch at the very end.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies GDB as C2/Indoor (PDF p.8) and unsuitable for outdoors; however, it mentions 'carbon adsorption efficiency' risks for GDB, which is a particle filter housing (GDC is for carbon).
dimension_explanations.completeness: Addresses the safety constraints and offers an alternative, but the response ends with a repetitive text glitch ('To finalize the configuration:To finalize the configuration:') instead of a clear question.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety logic; correctly prevents the use of an uninsulated single-wall housing in an outdoor environment where condensation would be a failure mode.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and authoritative, though marred slightly by the text generation glitch at the end.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Sound engineering logic connecting uninsulated metal surfaces to outdoor condensation risks and corrosion acceleration.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' (Indoor use) limitation for GDB stated in the PDF (p.8).

strengths: Correctly blocks GDB (C2, uninsulated) for outdoor rooftop application.
Suggests the technically superior alternative (GDMI FLEX) which features insulation and ZM/C4 material.
Validates airflow (3400 mÂ³/h) against the correct table for GDB 600x600 (PDF p.9).
weaknesses: Hallucinates 'carbon adsorption' risks for a GDB housing (which is for particle filters, not carbon).
Minor text generation glitch at the end of the response.

The recommendation to block GDB for outdoor rooftop is directionally correct engineering, but the suggestion of GDMI FLEX as an outdoor alternative is problematic since GDMI FLEX is also explicitly stated as 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' (indoor use) in the PDF. The response is incomplete, cutting off mid-sentence.

However, the system incorrectly characterizes GDB as 'bolted construction' â€” it is a single-wall uninsulated housing with PG/flange connection. dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly identifies that FZ (C2 corrosion class per PDF p.8, though system says C2 which matches) is inadequate for year-round outdoor weather exposure, and raises valid concerns about condensation on uninsulated surfaces â€” sound safety reasoning even if the alternative suggestion is flawed.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative tone appropriate for a technical sales engineering context, though the duplicated sentence fragment is unprofessional.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The cause-effect chain about outdoor exposure â†’ condensation â†’ corrosion is valid HVAC reasoning, but the logic jumps when suggesting GDMI FLEX as an outdoor alternative without acknowledging it is also indoor-rated. The 'bolted construction' framing is imprecise.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly blocks GDB FZ for outdoor use (GDB is stated as indoor use in PDF p.8), but then suggests GDMI FLEX which has the same indoor-only constraint per PDF p.18, representing a constraint violation in the alternative recommendation.

content_segments.text: For the rooftop exhaust application, the GDB filter housing with galvanized steel (FZ) is not suitable for outdoor installation. The GDB housing uses bolted construction, which does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for outdoor environments. Outdoor installation also exposes the system to Outdoor Condensation and High Humidity. Outdoor Condensation on the C2-rated housing can cause condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces, while High Humidity reduces the carbon adsorption efficiency and accelerates zinc corrosion.
inference_logic: Outdoor installation requires a housing rated for outdoor use.
Bolted construction does not meet leakage class and hygiene requirements for outdoor environments.
Outdoor Condensation can cause condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces.
High Humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency and accelerates zinc corrosion.
